text: Hi! is there any incompatibility if I use the framework materialize.css into HubSpot? <http://materializecss.com> Would be any incompatibility with the cos responsive grid which is based on bootstrap2?
<@U39U75WDS> The main issues you main find is the html markup with forms and such.
You dont need to use the Grid from Materialize
The other thing you could do is to hand code your own templates instead of using the Drag and drop template editor .. you can write, basically, any Markup you want except for modules.
Also, if you're using the Sass version, you could probably use @extend methods on the default HS markup classes, basically reusing their class names as whatever you'd like them to be in materialize.

actually as you said <@U38EZFVFE> I donÂ´t need to use the grid from materialize becouse HubSpot use already one based on bootstrap. 
I just want to use the styles from materialize for the forms to get effects like this
<http://materializecss.com/forms.html>
My doubt is that if I install the framework on the template would be any problem with the grid of HubSpot because materialize has its own grid?
I'd just pull out the forms css and add that to my page that way I diidn't have any issues / as well as keeping the size of it down
thank you <@U25PYL3Q8>, I will get only the styles for the form and I will add it to my template. I let you know the result :slightly_smiling_face:

might need to grab the JS too if you are looking to have things like the labels move when entering the fields and so on. Not sure if you would need to rewrite any of the JS to include HS classes (though you might need to).
Very good idea. I didn't look at the framework at all. I was speaking on a high level and should have mentioned that
I just took a peek at it because I never looked at it before lol
